item.title: Dystopian technology meets mass incarceration. Read why we must...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Dystopian technology meets mass incarceration. Read why we must stop the spread of risk assessment tools – where a computer tries to predict your behavior – and decides whether or not you stay in jail. These tools make too many mistakes. Read more: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

Bring Our Neighbors Home Bring Our Neighbors Home is a multi-year, community-driven campaign to ensure that poverty is not a crime and the presumption of innocence is more than theory. Every day, over 13,000 of our neighbors languish in Colorado’s … Continue reading →

item.title: Watch the Free Them All vigil happening now at the GEO...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Watch the Free Them All vigil happening now at the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights was live.

***seguido por español***
#COVID19 threatens the lives of everyone imprisoned, with outbreaks in more than two dozen carceral setting in Colorado right now. We ...know #DetentionIsDeadly and the only safe course of action for people in cages, the workers at those facilities and the #publichealth is to #FreeThemAll.
*** #COVID19 representa una amenaza a toda nuestra gente encarcelada. Colorado se encuentra con brotes en mas de dos docenas en lugares carcelarios ahora mismo. Sabemos que la detención es mortal y que el único curso de acción seguro, tanto para las personas en jaulas, los trabajadores en estos lugares y la #saludpublica es liberarlos a todos.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement’s decision to return to business as usual and the GEO detention center in Aurora are not keeping our community safe. Experts like Dr. Carlos Franco Paredes are calling for compassionate humanitarian release of all imprisoned people. Tonight, we will hear from loved ones of those jailed, impacted individuals and the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado about how your donations can free our people!
***La decisión de la migra de regresar a operativos “normales” conjunto con como GEO maneja su centro de detención, ponen en peligro la seguridad de nuestra comunidad. Expertos como Dr. Carlos Paredes están clamando por una liberación humanitaria de todas las personas encarceladas. ¡Esta noche escucharemos de los seres queridos de la gente aprisionada, de personas detenidas y del Fondo de Liberación de Inmigrantes en Colorado sobre como sus donativos pueden rescatar a nuestra gente!

This event is brought to you by the American Friends Service Committee, the Colorado People’s Alliance, the Colorado Freedom Fund AND the Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.
****Este evento es patrocinado por el Comité de Servicio de los Amigos Americanos en Colorado, Colorado People’s Alliance, Colorado Freedom Fund Y TAMBIEN el Immigrant Freedom Fund of Colorado.

See More
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Pretrial risk assessment tools are built using biased policing...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Pretrial risk assessment tools are built using biased policing and criminal legal data steeped in structural racism. Cloaking a broken system behind an aura of technology and objectivity doesn’t make it right. If we want a more just system we must do better than relying on pretrial RATS.
https://bit.ly/3n8e9KC

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

boulderweekly.com

Analyzing the risk - Boulder Weekly

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

item.title: It's morally abhorrent to deprive a presumptively innocent...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

It's morally abhorrent to deprive a presumptively innocent person of their pretrial liberty based on a concern they might get a traffic ticket or fail to show up in court. Yet that's what happens in CO every day when judges use risk assessment tools. https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

item.title: Join us tonight at 6 p.m. for a socially-distanced caravan at...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us tonight at 6 p.m. for a socially-distanced caravan at the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora. During a deadly pandemic, GEO cannot be trusted to protect the lives of our friends and family. We must demand that people are safely released:

WHEN: Tonight at 6 p.m.
WHERE: 3130 Oakland St.
WHAT: We will caravan to the Denver Women’s Correctional Facility and Denver County Jail and back while listening to advocates and testimony via Facebook Live.

...

RSVP: https://www.facebook.com/events/848905575513773

item.title: "The goal of any democratic election is to represent the...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"The goal of any democratic election is to represent the will of the people — not the politicians. To achieve that goal, we must count every single vote otherwise our elections count for nothing. Let’s accept an extended election process and ensure the votes of the American people — all the people — are respected." - ACLU of Colorado Voting Rights Campaign Coordinator Jen Samano

In an unprecedented year, it’s only natural that we have an unprecedented election. While many of us may have wished for the relief of knowing the results on election night, this time it may take d…

denverpost.com

Guest Commentary: Voters decide the winners

In an unprecedented year, it’s only natural that we have an unprecedented election. item.title: Once again, Coloradans have made it clear that private medical...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Once again, Coloradans have made it clear that private medical decisions should be made without political interference. There is nothing reasonable about restricting access to essential medical care — not now, not ever. #NoOn115 https://bit.ly/3l3AEQ8

Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.

huffpost.com

Colorado Rejects Ballot Initiative Seeking To Ban Abortion Later In Pregnancy

Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.

item.title: Coloradans have made it clear, when it comes to picking our...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Coloradans have made it clear, when it comes to picking our country’s president the candidate with the most votes must win. One person should always equal one vote. We all matter.

item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Amendment 76 was brought to Colorado’s ballot by Florida...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Amendment 76 was brought to Colorado’s ballot by Florida politicians who wanted to use Colorado as a guinea pig to give power to an anti-immigrant agenda. Colorado already had a citizenship requirement for voting. Despite this loss, we will continue to work hard to make voting accessible to every citizen. Thank you to everyone who canvassed, made calls, made videos, texted and talked to friends and family about why Amendment 76 was wrong for Colorado. We won’t stop until we rejoin the 48 other states that value voting rights for young people and immigrants. We are not defeated, we simply have more work to do.

Vote No on 76

See our statement at www.votenoon76.com (link in bio)

See the results and other info about the 2020 US Election. See Election Results
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a newborn baby, or a seriously ill family member at some point, but 4 out of 5 Coloradans don’t have access to paid family and medical leave. Thanks to Proposition 118 passing more Coloradans can finally put their families first without having to risk losing their job.

Yes On 118: Colorado Families First
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Boulder just became the 7th jurisdiction to win the right to...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Boulder just became the 7th jurisdiction to win the right to counsel for fighting mass evictions. All people — regardless of their circumstances or background — should have access to safe and stable housing. NEWR is key to fighting mass evictions that impact communities of color and women the most. No one should be evicted for being who they are, especially during a pandemic.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: This was not the first attempt to pass an abortion ban in...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

This was not the first attempt to pass an abortion ban in Colorado and it may not be the last. But we know from experience that the fight for reproductive rights and justice is successful when we stick together. Thanks to all of your efforts, health needs will continue to drive important medical decisions — not politics. Read the full release here: https://bit.ly/38421pE
